summary: The American Access to Banking Act aims to facilitate the formation of new (de novo) regulated financial institutions, such as banks and credit unions. It directs federal agencies to streamline application processes, review capital-raising restrictions, and establish outreach programs. The bill mandates reviews of application forms, promotes information gathering from other agencies, requires reports to Congress, and encourages mentorship programs. Furthermore, it calls for state and stakeholder engagement to promote cooperation and inform reforms. The bill defines key terms and clarifies the application process.
